means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 韦克斯 Waxman的变体

word_mean: 蜡：从昆虫或植物中提取的一种可塑性物质。各种蜡是各种脂肪酸和高级醇(往往是一羟醇)的酯。药用蜡主要是黄蜡(蜂蜡)，蜜蜂用它制造蜂房。蜂蜡的主要成分是蜡酸和杨梅脂，该蜡用于油膏和蜡膏等的制备。黄蜡漂白后即成白蜡

sentence.Network_en: She loved the scent in the house of wax polish.
sentence.Network_cn: 她喜欢房子里打过蜡的味道。

sentence.Network_en: Hearing can be affected by ear wax blocking the ear canal.
sentence.Network_cn: 耳垢堵塞耳道可能会影响听力。

sentence.Network_en: Her skin is pale, the texture of fine wax.
sentence.Network_cn: 她肤色苍白，肤质细腻如蜡。

lj.lj_ly: green sentiment has waxed and waned.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wæx, weax, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch was and German Wachs. The verb dates from late Middle English
Old English weaxan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wassen and German wachsen, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek auxanein and Latin augere 'to increase'
mid 19th cent.: origin uncertain; perhaps from phrases such as wax angry

encyclopedia.content: 个人履历 韩国著名女歌手Wax，她的曲风呈多元化，可以说是一个很有实力的歌手。 从2000年到现在已经推出了正式韩语专辑5张，精选集1张，和一张日文专辑， 很多中国的朋友是通过《海豚湾恋人》ost中的《想爱》而知道她。其 实除了大家熟悉的《想爱》外，她有多首被人熟悉 的歌曲。 只是都不知道是她的歌曲而已，就例如像《发困》，《坐着地铁》（《地铁》），《Money》，这几首歌，只要是舞曲爱好者，相信都有听过和收藏。 ———

entry.def: Wax is a solid, slightly shiny substance made of fat or oil which is used to make candles and polish. It melts when it is heated.

example.ex: There were coloured candles which had spread pools of wax on the furniture...
example.tran: 彩色蜡烛在家具上留下一摊摊蜡油。

example.ex: She loved the scent in the house of wax polish.
example.tran: 她喜欢房子里打过蜡的味道。

entry.def: If you wax a surface, you put a thin layer of wax onto it, especially in order to polish it.

example.ex: We'd have long talks while she helped me wax the floor.
example.tran: 她帮我给地板打蜡时我们谈了很久。

example.ex: ...all those Sundays spent washing and waxing the car.
example.tran: 那些用来洗车和给车上蜡的星期天

entry.def: If you have your legs waxed, you have the hair removed from your legs by having wax put on them and then pulled off quickly.

example.ex: She has just had her legs waxed at the local beauty parlour...
example.tran: 她刚在当地一家美容院除了腿毛。

example.ex: She could go shopping, and wax her legs.
example.tran: 她可以去逛商店，顺便除一下腿毛。

entry.def: Wax is the sticky yellow substance found in your ears.
If you say that someone, for example, waxes lyrical or waxes indignant about a subject, you mean that they talk about it in an enthusiastic or indignant way.

example.ex: He waxed lyrical about the skills and commitment of his employees...
example.tran: 他津津乐道于员工的技能和敬业精神。

example.ex: My mother waxed eloquent on the theme of wifely duty.

entry.def: If something waxes and wanes, it first increases and then decreases over a period of time.

example.ex: Portugal and Spain had possessed vast empires that waxed and waned.
example.tran: 葡萄牙和西班牙都曾是经历了兴衰的大帝国。

means.word_mean: 1. any of various substances of either mineral origin or plant or animal origin; they are solid at normal temperatures and insoluble in water
